column2: Collecting data through structured sets of questions administered to respondents.
| Conducting controlled tests to investigate cause-and-effect relationships.
Systematically recording behaviors or events in their natural settings.
In-depth examination of a single case or a small number of cases.
Analysing textual or visual content for patterns, themes, or meanings.
Examining historical records and documents to gather information.
Conducting one-on-one or group discussions to collect qualitative data.
Analysing existing data collected for a different purpose.
Examining written or textual materials to extract insights.
Gathering and analysing data from online sources, platforms, or surveys.
Group discussions with participants to explore opinions and experiences.
A structured, iterative approach to reach a consensus among experts.
| Collecting data from a group of participants at a single point in time.
A comprehensive and systematic examination of existing research in a particular field.
Analysing physiological or behavioral data, such as fingerprints or heart rate.
